intro: Taraxacum blanditum, commonly known as the slender dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and a flowering stem that bears a single, yellow composite flower head. The plant produces a distinctive, hollow, hairless stem that supports the flower and later the characteristic seed ball. It is typically found in moist, grassy habitats and is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils. The species is often mistaken for other dandelion species due to its similar appearance and growth habits.
